div.p: MULTIAGE INSTRUCTION OVERVIEW So… what is multiage? Simply put, a multiage classroom is comprised of students of mixed ages. Typically children are in classes of 5-6-7, 6-7-8, 7-8-9, 8-9-10 year olds and so on. Children spend the entire 2-3 years...

TECHNOLOGY PLAN PLAN INTRODUCTION Plan Last Edited: 02/24/2009 Technology Planning Committee: Fernando Donatti - Superintendent/CEO Ayanna Williams - Board President Roberto Aramayo - Technology Department Patricia Beistegui- Teacher Carmen Rivera - Dean of Instruction Angeles Moreno - Parent EXECUTIVE SUMMARY...

DRAW Dual Language Program Program Content and Design Draw Academy offers a Dual Language immersion program. The Academy serves predominantly second language at-risk population. The students’ families are mainly from Latin American countries, the Middle East and Africa. The school...

Dear Parents
Due the COVID19 restrictions and school closures, you might have not submitted the application for, either
New-enrollment (new student) or Re-enrollment (student previously attending DRAW).
Below is a link to the form.
Please print it, complete as much as you can and bring it to the school as soon as possible, any day
Monday to Friday, during the daily "Meal-pick-up-line" at the Upper Elementary building from 7:00 to 9:30
am.
If you have problems printing, we can provide you with a printed form and help you to complete it, at the
“Meal-pick-up-line”;.
Finally, if you have already presented the form during regular school days, you may ask us at the “Meal-
pick-up-line”, and we will inform you if anything is missing.
Thank you and stay safe and at home.
Fernando Donatti
CEO/Superintendent

Estimados padres
Debido a las restricciones de COVID19 y el cierre de la escuela, es posible que no haya presentado la
solicitud de Nueva inscripción (nuevo estudiante) o Reinscripción (estudiante que asistió previamente a
DRAW).
A continuación, hay un enlace al formulario.
Por favor imprímalo, complete todo lo que pueda y tráigalo a la escuela lo antes posible, cualquier día de
Lunes a Viernes, durante la "Línea de comidas" diariamente en el edificio de Upper Elementary de 7:00 a
9:30 am.
Si tiene problemas para imprimir, podemos proporcionarle un formulario impreso y ayudarlo a completarlo
en la “Línea de comidas”.
Finalmente, si ya ha presentado el formulario durante los días escolares regulares, puede preguntarnos en
la “Línea de comidas” y le informaremos si falta algo.
Gracias y manténganse seguro y en su casa.

div.h3:
DRAW Academy is hiring:
UPPER ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL TEACHERS
FINE ARTS TEACHER
PLEASE SEND YOUR RESUME TO
draw@drawacademy.org
Interviews will be arranged for mid June

blockquote.h3:
The uppermost mature stage of evolution requires that human beings not just welcome cultural difference but that purposefully seek and learn from such differences. Encouraging diverse thinking creates a new, richer, open minded, and therefore more competent individual. This new person is capable of further understanding, develops into a better link of the interlinked global society web in more effective ways, and therefore, is able to provide contribution for the betterment of the surrounding environment. That is perhaps the highest meaning of life. Those who do not understand the value of this adaptation and respect to a universal culture, remain forever in the constricts of their own and limited world, never learning, thus never evolving.
Fernando Donatti

h3.a: Click here to view Student Code of Conduct

div.p: The DRAW Academy admits and provides services to all students of any race, color, national and ethnic origin, age, disability, sex, gender identity, religion, to all the rights, privileges, programs, and activities generally accorded or made available to students at the school. In accordance with TEC 12.111(6), DRAW Academy Charter School do not discriminate on the basis of sex, national origin, ethnicity, religion, disability, academic, artistic, or athletic ability, or the district the child would otherwise attend in administration of its educational policies, admissions policies, scholarship and loan programs, and athletic and other school-administered programs.
“One hundred percent of our teachers are Highly Qualified according to the requirements of the No Child Left Behind (NCLB) Act”

3920 Stoney Brook Dr
Houston TX 77063
Phone: 713-706-3729
Fax: 713-706-3711

Fernando Donatti
email
CEO-Superintendent- Founder
"TEXAS EDUCATION AGENCY"
Texas Education Agency
Recognized Charter School
Pre-kindergarten to eight grade
Serving since 2001
